approach.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem
approach.translation[0].definitions[0].e: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
a new approach to teaching languages
approach.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a request from someone, asking you to do something for them
approach.translation[0].definitions[1].e: They made a direct approach to the minister of education.
approach.translation[0].definitions[2].d: movement towards or near to something
approach.translation[0].definitions[3].d: a road, path etc that leads to a place, and is the main way of reaching it
approach.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Soldiers were guarding the approaches to the city.
approach.translation[0].definitions[4].d: the final part of a plane’s flight, before it lands at an airport
approach.translation[0].definitions[4].e: It was clear to land so we made our approach.

approach.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to move towards or nearer to someone or something
approach.translation[1].definitions[0].e: As I approached the house, I noticed a light on upstairs.
approach.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to ask someone for something, or ask them to do something, especially when you are asking them for the first time or when you are not sure if they will do it
approach.translation[1].definitions[1].e: I have already been approached by several other companies  (=offered a job, work etc).
Students should be able to approach teachers for advice.
The charity approached several stores about giving food aid.
approach.translation[1].definitions[2].d: if an event or a particular time approaches, or you approach it, it is coming nearer and will happen soon
approach.translation[1].definitions[2].e: She was then approaching the end of her career.
The time is fast approaching when we will have to make a decision.
With winter approaching, many animals are storing food.
approach.translation[1].definitions[3].d: to begin to deal with a situation or problem in a particular way or with a particular attitude
approach.translation[1].definitions[3].e: It might be possible to approach the problem in a different way.
approach.translation[1].definitions[4].d: to be almost equal to something
approach.translation[1].definitions[4].e: He’s never had anything approaching a normal life.
